author: Reuters Editorial
title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX ends higher on U.S. inflation report, energy stocks
text: February 14, 2018 / 9:17 PM / in 8 minutes CANADA STOCKS-TSX ends higher on U.S. inflation report, energy stocks Reuters Staff 1 Min Read TORONTO, Feb 14 (Reuters) - Canada’s main stock index rose on Wednesday after investor sentiment rebounded following a bullish U.S. inflation report and energy stocks rallied on strong oil prices. The Toronto Stock Exchange’s S&P/TSX composite index unofficially closed up 111.8 points, or 0.73 percent, to 15,328.27. Seven of the index’s 10 main groups were in positive territory. (Reporting by John Tilak; Editing by James Dalgleish)
